00056 #ifndef SBWDEFS
00057 #define SBWDEFS
00058 
00059 // There is no DLL business under Linux, so we just use "extern".
00060 
00061 #ifdef LINUX
00062 #define SBW_API
00063 #else
00064 
00065 // The following ifdef block is the standard way of creating macros which
00066 // make exporting from a DLL simpler. All files within this DLL are
00067 // compiled with the SBW_EXPORTS symbol defined on the command line. this
00068 // symbol should not be defined on any project that uses this DLL. This way
00069 // any other project whose source files include this file see SBW_API
00070 // functions as being imported from a DLL, wheras this DLL sees symbols
00071 // defined with this macro as being exported.
00072 
00073 #ifdef SBW_EXPORTS
00074 #define SBW_API __declspec(dllexport)
00075 #else
00076 #define SBW_API __declspec(dllimport)
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 #include <assert.h>
00080 
00081 #if defined(WIN32) && ! defined(CYGWIN)
00082 // disable silly messages about debug identifier sizes being too big, typically caused by the STL.
00083 #pragma warning(disable: 4786 4788)
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 
00087 #endif
00088 
00089 #endif /* SBWDEFS */
